did.abstract: Letters to Gardner relating to his work in Boston, Mass., Richmond, Va., and Hartford, Conn., on newspapers and periodicals including the Boston Quarterly Review, Brother Jonathan, Democratic Review, States Rights Republican (Richmond), The Sunbeam (Hartford), and Union and Messenger. Topics include Democratic politics, social democracy, and political reforms. Correspondents include Theophilus Fisk, who wrote from Portsmouth, Va., inviting Gardner to be editor of a weekly paper in Richmond that would advocate for a new state constitution, suffrage, public education, and labor rights.
